intro: Aframomum erythrostachyum, commonly known as the red-stemmed cardamom, is a tropical plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers followed by dark red berries containing numerous seeds. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
